bwwExcerpt: The best screen-to-stage adaptations involve the narrator (Travis Ward-Osborne), who after a painful opening number of throat clearing becomes the maitre d' at the Beverly Wilshire. He has a bevy of bellhops and footmen who are always ready to burst into ballroom dance, creating a hotel populated by fairy godfathers and fairy minions who maybe really could make dreams come true.
